thread.title: Macron, receiving Charlemagne prize, calls for ambitious European budget

title: Macron, receiving Charlemagne prize, calls for ambitious European budget
text:
May 10, 2018 / 11:12 AM / in 13 minutes Macron, receiving Charlemagne prize, calls for ambitious European budget Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
AACHEN, Germany (Reuters) - French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday reiterated his call for the euro zone to have its own budget, saying Europe needed more ambitious financing to help defend its interests and bring about economic and fiscal convergence among member states. French President Emmanuel Macron speaks after being awarded the Charlemagne Prize during a ceremony in Aachen, Germany May 10, 2018. REUTERS/Wolfgang Rattay
“That’s why I believe in a stronger euro zone, more deeply integrated, with its own budget allowing for investments and convergence,” Macron said in the German town of Aachen after becoming only the second sitting French president to win the prestigious Charlemagne Prize. Reporting by Richard Lough; Editing by Gareth Jones
